items.title: How to hide faces and scrub metadata when you photograph a protest
items.author: William Joel
items.summary:
• People may want to obscure faces during protests to protect identities from the authorities.
• Use irreversible methods to remove faces, like painting over or using mosaic blur techniques.
• Remove all metadata from images to prevent tracking through GPS or timestamps.
• Use built-in photo editors on iOS and Android to cover faces.
• Taking screenshots of images can be a simple way to avoid metadata.
• Encrypted messaging apps like Signal offer face-blurring tools.

items.title: Amazon announces AI-powered Alexa Plus
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Amazon is launching the generative AI version of Alexa, called Alexa Plus.
- New features include ordering groceries, sending event invites, and memorizing personal preferences.
- Alexa Plus can hold conversations, analyze images, and perform tasks like booking dinner reservations and creating itineraries.
- It will integrate with smart home devices and have enhanced music finding capabilities.
- Alexa Plus uses a model-agnostic system, choosing the best AI model for each task.
- The service can draw on data from partners like The Associated Press and Politico to provide information on topics like sports and finance.
- Initially announced in September 2023, Alexa Plus aims to compete against other AI assistants like Google Gemini and Apple's Siri.

items.title: Lucid’s CEO steps down, as EV maker aims to double production
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- CEO Peter Rawlinson will step down but remain with the company as Strategic Technical Advisor.
- COO Marc Winterhoff appointed as interim CEO.
- Lucid plans to double production from 10,241 vehicles in 2024 to an expected 20,000 in 2025.
- The company reported a net loss of $636.9 million in Q4 and $3.06 billion for the year 2024.
- New Gravity SUV launched, offering 440 miles range and 800 horsepower.
- The Gravity will feature a native NACS charging port compatible with Tesla Superchargers.

items.title: Amazon Alexa event live blog: all the news from the keynote
items.author: Todd Haselton
items.summary:
- Amazon is set to announce new features for Alexa at 10AM ET today.
- Expected updates include AI-powered capabilities, potentially costing $5 to $10 per month.
- The new version of Alexa has been delayed for a month due to accuracy issues.
- Anticipated new products that may accompany the announcement include updated Echo devices and other Amazon devices.

items.title: Doctor Who returns in April with an evil new cartoon villain
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Ncuti Gatwa's version of the Doctor returns on **April 12, 2025**, on Disney Plus and BBC.
- The new season will consist of **eight** episodes with weekly releases.
- Introduction of a new companion, **Belinda Chandra**, played by Varada Sethu.
- The plot involves the Doctor's adventure to return to Earth, facing new threats including the villain **Mr Ring-a-Ding**, a cartoon character voiced by Alan Cumming.
- The season builds on Gatwa's previous season and includes a spinoff series titled **The War Between The Land And The Sea** in development.

items.title: All the news from Amazon's AI Alexa event
items.author: Todd Haselton
items.summary:
- Amazon's Alexa event is scheduled for February 26th, 10AM ET in New York City.
- A new subscription-based version of Alexa with enhanced AI features is expected to be announced.
- Anticipation includes potential launches of new Echo devices, Fire TV products, and possibly smart glasses.
- Reports suggest that the revamped Alexa may face delays due to accuracy issues, possibly pushing the launch to March 31 or later.
- During the event, Amazon aims to reveal its vision for generative AI's role in homes, following previous delays and challenges.

items.title: Framework Desktop hands-on: A New Direction for Gaming Desktops
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Framework aims to create modular and upgradeable consumer electronics, expanding into desktop PCs with a new gaming desktop.
- The desktop features an AMD Ryzen AI Max processor with integrated graphics comparable to Nvidia's RTX 4060 and supports up to 96GB of unified LPDDR5x memory.
- Benchmarks show promising performance, achieving 73fps in Cyberpunk 2077 at 1440p without ray tracing, outperforming PS5.
- The design includes customizable I/O ports and easy-to-remove magnetic panels for personalization.
- Initial impressions suggest limited upgradeability compared to Framework's laptops, raising questions on future revisions and upgradability options.

items.title: Google makes it easier to remove your contact information from Search results
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google has updated its 'Results about you' tool for easier removal of personal information from Search results.
- Users can register their personal data to monitor and request removal of sensitive info.
- The tool is currently available in select countries, with plans for expansion.
- Users can request removals directly from Search results with a new 'remove this result' option.
- New feature allows for refreshing outdated Search results when users update their information on the source website.

items.title: More than 1 billion people are now watching podcasts on YouTube every month
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- YouTube has reached 1 billion monthly viewers for podcasts, surpassing Apple and Spotify.
- Spotify reported 100 million regular podcast listeners as of 2023, with half a billion having listened to a podcast since 2019.
- YouTube requires creators to make native video content, which can be costly, affecting how podcasters produce their shows.
- Over 400 million hours of podcasts were watched on TVs via YouTube last year, emphasizing the importance of video content in this medium.
- Creators must navigate YouTube's specific rules for advertising and metrics, making it different from traditional podcast platforms.

items.title: Qualcomm wants to bring longer Android support to more phones
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Qualcomm and Google agree to extend Android support updates to up to eight years for Snapdragon 8 and 7-series chips.
- The eight years includes the release year, equating to seven years of Android version upgrades.
- Supported devices include Samsung Galaxy S25, Xiaomi 15, OnePlus 13, and Asus ROG Phone 9.
- Extended support is not guaranteed; manufacturers decide on implementation.
- Phones with older Snapdragon chips won’t qualify for the extended updates.

items.title: ChatGPT is a terrible, fascinating, and thrilling to-do list app
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- ChatGPT sends daily workout and meditation reminders, but repetition is noted as a drawback.
- New features like 'Tasks' and 'Operator' aim to improve productivity by allowing reminder setting and task completion.
- User experience with task management is complicated; tasks sometimes fail to register or are lost in memory.
- ChatGPT can suggest recipes and draft emails, aiding in task initiation but lacks project management tools.
- 'Operator' opens a browser to complete tasks autonomously but struggles with vague requests and lacks integration with personal accounts for online shopping.
- Overall, ChatGPT's productivity features are seen as a mix of useful and flawed, hinting at potential future improvements in AI-assisted organization.

items.title: All the news about Nvidia’s RTX 50-series GPUs
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Nvidia GeForce RTX 5070 Ti is positioned as a cheaper alternative to the RTX 4080.
- Reports suggest Nvidia should have delayed the launch of the RTX 5090 and 5080 models.
- The RTX 5080 has been noted to have lower than expected gains.
- Nvidia has confirmed black screen driver issues with its RTX cards are being addressed in a forthcoming update.
- Some RTX graphics cards, including the RTX 5080, were found missing ROPs due to a manufacturing defect.
- Nvidia is offering replacements for affected consumers.
- RTX 5090 is highlighted as a leading 4K graphics card.
- The 5070 Ti aims to deliver performance similar to the RTX 4090 at a lower price point.
- Acknowledgment of the removal of PhysX support in the new 50-series GPUs, impacting older game performance.

items.title: Volvo ES90 will charge faster, drive farther than other Volvo EVs
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- The Volvo ES90 electric sedan will be officially revealed next month, featuring enhanced range and battery efficiency.
- Equipped with an 800-volt architecture, the ES90 can add 300km (186 miles) of range in just 10 minutes at a 350kW fast-charging station.
- It promises a driving range of up to 700km (435 miles) under the WLTP testing cycle.
- Upgrades include lighter, more efficient motors and a new battery management software that reduces charging time to 20 minutes from 10 to 80 percent.
- The car will utilize a significant amount of recycled materials and include a blockchain-based battery passport to track raw materials used in the battery.

items.title: ‘We’re nowhere near done with Framework Laptop 16’ says Framework CEO
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Framework Laptop 16 was initially highlighted two years ago as an ambitious upgradable graphics laptop.
- At a recent event, the focus shifted to the new Framework Desktop, with little mention of Laptop 16's advancements.
- A new One Key Module will allow the community to create custom keyboards for the Laptop 16.
- The Framework CEO, Nirav Patel, affirmed that they are still working on Laptop 16, but declined to provide details on GPU upgrades or future mainboard updates.

items.title: Razer’s new Blade 18 offers Nvidia RTX 50-series GPUs and a dual mode display
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- Razer launches the new Blade 18 gaming laptop now available for preorder.
- Features include Nvidia RTX 50-series GPUs and Intel Arrow Lake CPUs.
- The 18-inch display offers dual modes: 3840 x 2400 at 240Hz or 1920 x 1200 at 440Hz.
- Starting price is $3,199.99 for RTX 5070 Ti, up to $4,499.99 for RTX 5090.
- Shipping expected by late-April for both Blade 18 and Blade 16.
- Competing laptops with RTX 50-series GPUs are also being offered by ASUS, MSI, and HP.

items.title: Samsung's first Pro series Gen 5 PCIe SSD arrives in March
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Samsung is releasing its first consumer-ready PCIe Gen 5 SSD, the 9100 Pro series, in March 2024.
- Available capacities: 1TB ($199.99), 2TB ($299.99), and 4TB ($549.99), with an 8TB model expected in late 2025.
- The 9100 Pro features up to 2,200K read and 2,600K write IOPS, significantly faster than the last-gen 980 Pro.
- Sequential read speed up to 14.8GBps and write speed of 13.4GBps, catering to heavy computing and large file transfers needs.
- Custom controller built on V Nand TLC V8 technology, providing enhanced performance for future workloads.

items.title: Trump’s first 100 days: all the news affecting the tech industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The White House named Amy Gleason as acting administrator of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).
- Lawsuit alleges Donald Trump broke the law by removing climate change references from USDA websites.
- Elon Musk gave federal workers deadline to respond to productivity email or face resignation.
- President Trump announced Dan Bongino as the new deputy director of the FBI.
- Apple plans to invest over $500 billion in the US and hire 20,000 employees in response to tariff threats.

items.title: We finally know who’s legally running DOGE
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary:
- Amy Gleason has been named the acting administrator of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).
- The announcement was made by an unnamed White House official to multiple media outlets, following confusion surrounding DOGE's leadership.
- Gleason's background includes previous work with the US Digital Service and Russell Street Ventures, but her current title's date and permanent leadership plans remain unclear.
- White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt declined to name a formal administrator and stated Musk is overseeing operations without formal association.
- Legal challenges against DOGE continue, complicating the leadership's public perception and responsibilities.

items.title: Apple is fixing a voice dictation bug that substitutes ‘Trump’ for ‘racist’
items.author: Chris Welch

items.title: How to secure your phone before attending a protest
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- The article discusses the importance of securing personal data on phones before attending protests, especially in a context of rising activism.
- Key recommendations include: leaving your phone at home, using a burner phone, and opting for strong passwords instead of biometrics for security.
- Additional tips suggest encrypting your device, using airplane mode, utilizing guided access features, employing secure communication apps like Signal, and considering a VPN for extra security.

items.title: Sonos speakers and soundbars are 25 percent off for existing customers
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Sonos is offering 25% off select products for existing customers until March 2, 2025.
- Customers must have registered a Sonos product by February 19, 2025, to qualify.
- Discounts include Sonos Ace headphones for $336.75 (down $112.25), and the Sonos Beam soundbar for $374.25 (down $124.75).
- The Sonos Move 2 is priced at $336.75 (down $112.25), while smaller Sonos Roam 2 is on sale for $134.25 (down $44.75).
- New smart speakers Sonos Era 100 and Era 300 are available for $186.75 (down $62) and $336.75 (down $112.25), respectively.

items.title: Xbox Cloud Gaming will let you invite friends with just a link
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Microsoft introduces shareable invite links for Xbox Cloud Gaming in the February update.
- Players can send and accept invites through Xbox messages or any messaging app.
- An active Xbox account is required; some games need Game Pass Ultimate.
- The feature allows players to join sessions on supported devices and revoke access as needed.
- Stream your own games added to Xbox Cloud Gaming recently, expanding available titles.

items.title: Infinity Nikki's Spooky New Event Will Test Cheapskate Skills
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- A new event called Eerie Season for the game *Infinity Nikki* starts on February 26th, featuring a dark theme.
- The update will introduce new outfits and expand on the Queen's Palace Ruins area with more lore and story content.
- The writer reflects on past experiences with the game's gacha system and expresses excitement about attempting to obtain a desired premium outfit without spending more money.

items.title: 8BitDo’s Ultimate 2 controller gets an upgrade to next-generation anti-drift sticks
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- 8BitDo has released an upgraded version of its Ultimate controller, the Ultimate 2, available for preorder at $59.99.
- The controller features Tunneling Magneto-Resistance (TMR) joysticks to reduce joystick drift, LED lighting, and additional buttons.
- Connectivity includes Bluetooth, wired USB-C, and 2.4GHz wireless via a USB dongle, compatible with Windows 10 and Android 9.0+ only.
- The triggers can switch between long draw for racing games and short pull for FPS, with customizable shoulder buttons added to the design.
- Compatibility for Xbox, iOS, and Nintendo Switch versions has yet to be announced.

items.title: Technicolor is winding down operations
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Technicolor Group is on the brink of collapse, threatening thousands of jobs.
- The company has begun winding down operations due to severe cash flow issues.
- CEO Caroline Parot cited COVID-19 setbacks and the 2023 writers strike as contributing factors.
- Technicolor has petitioned for receivership proceedings in Paris.
- The decision follows WARN notices received by US employees regarding potential mass layoffs.
- Technicolor has a history of financial difficulties, including a spin-off from Vantiva SA in 2020.

items.title: Warner Bros. Games cancels Wonder Woman game and shuts down three studios
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Warner Bros. Discovery is canceling the Wonder Woman game announced in 2021 and shutting down three studios: Monolith Productions, Player First Games, and Warner Bros. Games San Diego.
- The decision aims to restructure development around key franchises like Harry Potter, Mortal Kombat, DC, and Game of Thrones.
- The company states that the cancellation reflects strategic priorities rather than the talent of the teams involved.

items.title: From ChatGPT to Gemini: How AI is Rewriting the Internet
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- A Pew Research poll shows 52% of U.S. adults are concerned about AI’s impact on jobs, with mixed feelings regarding future job opportunities.
- Google introduces pricing for its Veo 2 AI video generator at 50 cents per second, significantly higher than OpenAI's offerings.
- Meta announces Project Waterworth, aiming to construct a 50,000-kilometer subsea cable to support AI infrastructure globally.

items.title: Framework’s first tiny Desktop beautifully straddles the line between cute and badass
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Framework has announced its first desktop PC, emphasizing the need for more 4.5-liter mini-ITX PCs.
- The desktop features AMD’s Strix Halo APU with up to 128GB of LPDDR5x memory.
- Users can customize the front panel with 21 interchangeable, 3D printable tiles and choose two front I/O ports.
- The motherboard supports a PCIe x4 port, onboard 5Gbps Ethernet, dual USB4, dual DisplayPort, HDMI, and two M.2 SSD slots for a total of 16TB storage.
- Prices range from $1,099 for the 8-core version to $1,999 for the top model, with mainboards available separately for $799.
- Preorders started today with shipping expected in Q3.

items.title: Framework wants to fix the budget laptop with its first touchscreen machine
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Framework introduces the Laptop 12, its smallest and first touchscreen model.
- Features include 2-in-1 convertible hinge and shock-absorbing TPU outer edge for durability.
- It will be easily repairable and configurable with a 13th Gen Intel Core i3 or i5 processor.
- Specifications include a 1920x1200 display, up to 48GB of RAM, and 2TB of NVMe storage.
- Pricing is yet to be announced but expected to be lower than Framework Laptop 13, starting at $750.
- Preorders are set to begin in April with shipping anticipated in mid-2025.

items.title: The Framework Laptop 13 has just been upgraded to AMD’s Strix Point
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Framework introduces a new modular AMD laptop starting at $449, with complete models priced from $899 to $1,099.
- Features AMD's new Ryzen AI 300 "Strix Point" chips, up to Ryzen 9 HX 370 with 12 cores and 50 TOPS of AI performance.
- Improvements include a new optional 2.8K 120Hz screen, four ports supporting four external displays, and enhanced cooling system.
- New keyboard design aims to prevent buzzing, includes a Copilot key for prebuilt models.
- Translucent bezels and matching USB-C expansion cards introduced in new color options.
- New models available for order today, shipping in April, with price reductions for previous-gen AMD laptops.

items.title: Donald Trump broke the law by removing climate change references from USDA websites, lawsuit alleges
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- A lawsuit claims the USDA’s removal of climate change information harms organic farmers.
- The suit was filed by the Northeast Organic Farming Association of New York and environmental groups after the USDA eliminated key webpages.
- Trump’s administration is accused of violating federal laws including FOIA and the Administrative Procedure Act.
- The lawsuit outlines that affected farmers relied on USDA resources for decision-making regarding climate change impacts.
- Previous online tools for assessing climate risks are no longer available, hindering farmers’ ability to adapt to changing conditions.
- The lawsuit also emphasizes issues with funding access for sustainable farming practices.
- The USDA has not commented on the lawsuit, while some webpages were restored earlier due to a different legal ruling.

items.title: Anker’s new USB-C HDMI cable supports 140W fast charging
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Anker has launched the Nano USB-C to HDMI Cable Adapter facilitating high-speed charging and video output.
- Compatible with Thunderbolt 5, it allows 140W power delivery while using an external display.
- Priced at $28.99, the current 3-foot version is set to expand with a 6-foot model in the future.
- While it works with various devices, it does not support portable docking for Nintendo Switch or some Dell, LG, and Samsung monitors due to connector sizing.

items.title: Dark Horse is shutting down its iOS comics app
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Dark Horse Digital service shutting down, affecting iOS comics app support.
- Users must download purchased comics by March 30th, support ends March 31st.
- Digital comics can still be accessed on the Dark Horse Digital website until summer 2025 for registered users.
- Dark Horse will continue to sell ebooks on other platforms, citing changes in consumer preferences.
- Refunds available for 2023 purchases, but iOS app refunds must go through Apple.
- Users reminded they do not own digital books, only a license to them, pointing to issues of digital ownership.

items.title: Microsoft makes Copilot Voice and Think Deeper free with unlimited use
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft has made OpenAI’s o1 reasoning model free for all Copilot users.
- Unlimited use of Copilot's Voice and Think Deeper features is now available for everyone.
- The move allows users to engage in extended conversations with Copilot's AI assistant.
- Microsoft previously had limits on these features for free users.
- The changes come after the launch of Copilot in Bing and the revamp of the Copilot Pro subscription, which costs $20 per month.

items.title: Chegg sues Google over AI Overviews
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Chegg filed a lawsuit against Google on February 24th, claiming that AI-generated summaries hurt its traffic and revenue.
- This lawsuit is regarded as the first antitrust case by a single company over Google's AI Overviews feature.
- Chegg alleges Google leverages its monopoly power to use Chegg's content without compensation, affecting its business model.
- Chegg's CEO stated that the lawsuit addresses broader issues in digital publishing, internet search, and access to educational resources.
- Google argues that its AI Overviews enhance diversity in site traffic on the web, providing billions of clicks daily.

items.title: Tesla reportedly launches FSD in China — or has it?
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Tesla begins to push a software update for Full Self-Driving features in China, marketed as "Urban Road Autopilot Assistance" (URAA).
- URAA guides vehicles on highways and urban roads, assisting with navigation and traffic signals.
- The Chinese version of FSD is reported to be "less capable" than the North American version due to insufficient training data on local roads.
- The update will be available only to vehicles with "HW 4.0" including recent Model Y and Model 3 cars.
- Delays in the rollout may hinder Tesla's competitiveness against Chinese EV makers like BYD and Xiaomi.
- Elon Musk's efforts for regulatory approval in China have faced challenges; plans for a local data center are considered.

items.title: Clicks’ BlackBerry-style keyboard case is coming to Android phones
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The Clicks keyboard case will soon be available for various Android devices, starting in April 2024.
- It has already sold over 100,000 units for iPhone models since its January 2024 launch.
- Preorders for Android cases begin immediately, with the Google Pixel 9 version priced at $99 until March 21, increasing to $139 thereafter.
- The keyboard case includes customizable functionalities via the Clicks Keyboard mobile app and features backlighting.
- The design allows for keyboard shortcuts and is compatible with USB-C for power, eliminating the need for battery units.

items.title: The new Beeper app combines all of Automattic’s messaging systems
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Beeper has announced a beta update to merge its services with Texts, acquired by Automattic in 2023.
- The new desktop version is based on the Texts desktop app, and the iOS app was developed from scratch.
- Beeper supports messaging across multiple platforms, including WhatsApp and Instagram.
- Plans to support iMessage in the desktop version and introduce features like end-to-end encryption and multiple account support are on the horizon.

items.title: You can get four Apple AirTags for a record low $68
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Apple AirTags are on sale for $67.99 for a four-pack, a savings of approximately $31.
- Single AirTags are available for $22.99 each at various retailers.
- AirTags utilize the Find My network for precise item tracking and have user-replaceable batteries.

items.title: UK Newspapers Unite Against AI Copyright Proposals
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Major UK newspapers feature the same campaign imagery on their covers to protest government proposals on AI and copyright.
- The campaign, dubbed 'Make It Fair', calls for protection of British creative industries against AI companies using copyrighted work without permission.
- A public consultation period on these proposals closed today, coinciding with the launch of the campaign on December 17th.
- Concerns raised that weakening copyright protections could devastate the UK’s $152 billion creative industry.
- The NMA, including major publications like The Sun and Daily Mail, leads the campaign against these government proposals.

items.title: Xbox’s new Fable game is delayed to 2026
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft has delayed the release of its upcoming game Fable to 2026, previously set for 2025.
- Xbox Game Studios chief Craig Duncan announced the delay during an official Xbox podcast, emphasizing the need for more development time.
- Early gameplay footage previews a hero named Humphry, who is drawn out of retirement to confront a threat to Albion.
- Playground Games, known for the Forza Horizon series, is developing the game, promising stunning visuals and engaging gameplay.

items.title: This RC purse redefines fast fashion with a top speed of 9 mph
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Nik Bentel Studio created a leather purse with a built-in remote control car.
- The RC Car Bag can reach a top speed of 9 mph and is designed for minimal obstacles.
- It includes a controller with a 30-foot range, but storage inside is limited.
- Priced at $295, the bag is questioned for its practicality versus fashion statement.
- Future updates could include Bluetooth for smartphone control and more color options.

items.title: The Peloton story: everything you need to know
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Peloton’s oldest bike tablet will be cut off from classes in a few months.
- Peloton’s app now pairs with third-party treadmills for some subscribers.
- CEO Peter Stern explained that no Peloton-branded hardware products are subject to tariffs from China, Mexico, or Canada.
- 2022 was marked by layoffs, gaffes, and negative press for Peloton.
- Peloton recalls its treadmills following a series of accidents.
- The company launches Strength Plus, an audio-based strength training app.
- Peloton partners with Fitbit, offering free access to classes for Fitbit Premium users.
- Reports of a private equity buyout are circulating amidst Peloton's financial struggles and ongoing layoffs.

items.title: Ron Wyden asks for rules about whether you own your digital purchases
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Sen. Ron Wyden urges the FTC to clarify that digital purchases often mean licensing, not ownership.
- Wyden's letter seeks guidance on license duration, transfer rights, and clear communication at the point of sale.
- Recent California law mandates that digital stores disclose licensing terms related to purchases, prompting companies to update their policies.

items.title: YouTube will show fewer ads in ‘interruptive’ slots
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Starting May 12th, YouTube will reduce mid-roll ads considered interruptive and increase ads at natural breaks.
- Automatic ad slots will be added to older videos; creators can choose between automatic and manual placements.
- An internal study found that a mix of automatic and manual ad slots generated five percent more revenue.
- Creators can opt out of automatic placements but may earn less with interruptive ads post-update.

items.title: The Casio Ring Watch is extremely silly, and that’s why I love it
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Casio Ring Watch, priced at $120, is designed to celebrate Casio's 50th anniversary.
- It is a tiny watch that fits on a finger, reminiscent of vintage watch rings from the '80s and '90s.
- The watch offers features like a stopwatch, alarm, and dual timezone but lacks fitness tracking.
- Currently, the ring watch is hard to find on the market, with prices exceeding $300 on eBay.
- Available only in a single size (10.5), it includes spacers for smaller fingers, but larger sizes are not accommodated.
- Users report receiving numerous compliments on the watch, enhancing its appeal beyond practicality.
- The battery lasts around two years without needing charging, making it low maintenance.
- The watch has quirky functionality, allowing discreet time-checking during conversations without being rude.

items.title: How AI PCs are removing barriers to workplace connection
items.author: Shawn Shinneman
items.summary: - AI PCs are playing a crucial role in enhancing workplace connections in the hybrid work environment. - 90% of businesses plan to maintain a hybrid work model, leading to a desire for better interaction among employees. - AI PCs such as Lenovo's ThinkPad X9 and ThinkPad X1 Carbon Gen 13 Aura improve collaboration and productivity. - The technology helps combat isolation by enabling better communication tools and user experiences across different technical capabilities. - Lenovo's AI PCs include features for enhancing user efficiency and addressing physical health concerns like eye strain and poor posture. - AI assistants, like Lenovo AI Now, improve workflow and adapt to user behaviors for enhanced productivity.

items.title: GIGABYTE’s latest AI motherboards push gaming performance forward
items.author: Vox Creative
items.summary:
- The B800 series motherboards debuted at CES on February 25, 2025.
- Designed for Intel B860 and AMD B850 chipsets, enhancing gaming performance.
- Incorporates AI-powered solutions for improved DDR5 memory performance, achieving overclocking up to 9466+ MT/s.
- Features like AI OC model for one-click performance boost and AI-driven PCB design contributing to overall efficiency.
- Premium thermal solutions and DIY-friendly designs included in both AMD B850 and Intel B860 models.
- X3D Turbo Mode available on the AMD B850 for optimized gaming performance with Ryzen processors.
- Offers a variety of models catering to different user needs and aesthetic preferences.

items.title: The future of the internet is likely smaller communities, with a focus on curated experiences
items.author: Edwin Wong
items.summary:
- The modern internet, nearly three decades old, is seen as outdated and in need of evolution.
- As AI rises, the definition of community and human connection is changing, impacting how brands and platforms engage.
- Research by Vox Media and Two Cents Insights shows that consumer power is shifting back, with a demand for more meaningful, authentic connection.
- Key findings include a decline in trust for big platforms, a desire for smaller communities, and an emphasis on content.
- Consumers prefer human-driven engagement over AI and automation, with many favoring intimate, purpose-driven communities.

items.title: Panasonic’s Lumix S1RII full-frame camera captures 8K video
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Panasonic announces Lumix S1RII, an upgrade from the S1R, featuring a new 44.3-megapixel back-side illuminated CMOS sensor.
- Capable of recording 8K video at 30fps, it also supports 5.8K Apple ProRes RAW HQ or ProRes RAW recording.
- Improved autofocus with phase-detect AF and enhanced AI tracking for various subjects.
- Capable of capturing 12-bit RAW stills at up to 40 fps with an electronic shutter.
- Handheld high-resolution mode allows capturing images at 177-megapixels.
- In-body image stabilization improved with 8 stops of shake reduction.
- Expected availability in late March for $3,299.99.
